sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Armenian-Azerbaijan forces reach a ceasefire deal after two days of fighting flared in the Nagorno-Karabakh region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: King Charles and Queen Camilla arrive in Paris for a three-day state visit, aimed at highlighting the friendship between France and Britain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The migrant crisis tops the agenda during talks held between the presidents of Italy and Germany in the Italian city of Syracuse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The European Commission recommends the EU member states extend the authorization of the controversial herbicide glyphosate for another 10 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: To the relief of residents and the international community,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: a ceasefire for the separatist Nagorno-Karabakh region has been reached between Armenian and Azerbaijan forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: This after local officials said scores of people had been killed or wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Azeri soldiers on Tuesday used heavy artillery fire at so-called Armenian positions in the region in what Baku described as an anti-terrorist operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They initially said they would continue their operation until the separatist government of Nagorno-Karabakh dismantled itself and illegal Armenian military formations surrendered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The agreement was reached through negotiations with the Russian peacekeeping troops in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: According to the Azeri Defense Ministry, the deal contemplates the withdrawal of Armenian military units and equipment from Nagorno-Karabakh, as well as disarming the local defense forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, thousands of protesters gathered in Yerevan on Tuesday to demand that authorities defend the ethnic Armenians living in the territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Clashes broke out with the police and a total of 34 people, 18 civilians and 16 officers were reported to have been injured as a result.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Tensions between Azerbaijan and Armenia have been simmering long before this latest violent eruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Euronews spoke to two high-level representatives on both sides for their perspectives on the causes and consequences of the recent fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: What did Azerbaijan, they left all these commitments and they started military aggression against peaceful people of Nagorno-Karabakh, which they claim that they are their own citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So right now, Azerbaijan is bombing and killing their own citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It was an unlimited operation, as a result of which this military infrastructure has been neutralized to a greater extent. And today, we are glad to say that military operations have been halted from Azerbaijan's side as well, while getting this message from Karabakh Armenians that they are disarming their armed forces on the ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Azerbaijan made its intention very clear that if they disarm or decide to disarm, Azerbaijan is ready to hold this military engagement and to start immediate contacts with the Karabakh Armenians that we have on multiple occasions invited to Yevlakh and some other cities of Azerbaijan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And yesterday, the presidential administration of Azerbaijan made an advice statement once again reiterating and our invitation to them to have this kind of context about all elements of reintegration.

sentences.sentence: I have no information because we have very bad connections with Nagorno-Karabakh.

sentences.sentence: There are different informations coming. Now this is a new thing, maybe it's not new thing actually, but in this process, I mean, directly attacking villages and peaceful settlements of people, you know, to push them out from Nagorno-Karabakh.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.sentence: During the draft, during the negotiations, we were negotiating rights and security guarantees for Nagorno-Karabakh people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: World leaders arrive in New York to listen to what Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: has to say.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's the first time he has visited the United Nations headquarters since Russia's war begun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Facing a fragmented international community, he called to exclude Russia from the ranks of the UNSC.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: VOLODYMYR ZELENSKYY, Ukrainian President of the United Nations The Ukrainian peace formula is becoming global.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Its points offer solutions and steps that will stop all forms of weaponization that Russia used against Ukraine and other countries and maybe used by other aggressors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For the first time in modern history, we have real chance to end the aggression on the terms of the nation which was attacked.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Zelensky participated in many meetings, in particular with African leaders to discuss food security and also with U.S. House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, who questioned how aid money was being spent. What is the plan for victory? I think that's what the American public wants to know. Look, what Russia has done in Vade is wrong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We want to make sure that ends.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I also have always said from the beginning, no matter what the issue is, I want accountability for whatever the hardworking taxpayers spend their money on, and I want a plan for victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Kiev demands more weapons and armament for its counteroffensive, which so far has had limited success.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But it also needs other resources to protect civilian population and infrastructure from recurring Russian airstrikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Britain's King Charles III and Queen Camilla have arrived in Paris for a long-awaited state visit,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: postponed from March due to violent protests sweeping France. King Charles III and Queen Camilla have arrived in Paris for a long-awaited state visit, postponed from March due to violent protests sweeping France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: President Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte welcomed the royal couple with a formal ceremony at the Arc de Triomphe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The visit comes amid a recent warming in the Franco-British relationship after years marked by Brexit talks and disputes over migrants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The French presidential palace said the three-day visit is a sign of the deep historical ties that unite the two countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Charles and Macron then held talks at the Élysée Palace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They discussed the situation in the Sahel and Ukraine as well as climate and biodiversity. On Thursday, Charles will address the Senate where he's expected to give part of his speech in French.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Irregular migration was at the top of the agenda during talks held in Syracuse

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: between the presidents of Italy and Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Sergio Mattarella and Frank-Walter Steinmeier, who came to the Sicilian town for an awards ceremony, shared their concerns about the issue that is proving difficult to solve and that must be dealt with at the European level.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Despite having clashed over the migration issue in the past few days, Italy and Germany have one thing in common.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: That's according to German President Steinmeier, who thinks that Italy and Germany are facing more difficulties in taking migrants, and he thinks that both are at the limit of their capacities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This is exactly what President Steinmeier told Italian newspaper Il Corriere della Sera in an interview that was published ahead of his three-day visit to Italy. As we know, Germany had suspended the voluntary intake of migrants from Italy, although that changed a few days ago with Germany resuming the agreement between the two countries. Now Germany has received around 162,000 asylum requests in 2023 alone. And it's the EU country that has received the highest number of migrants arriving on Italian shores under a voluntary agreement. Now according to President Steinmeier the strength of bilateral relations between Italy and Germany won't be undermined by the current crisis, but he thinks, and that's what he told Italian newspaper Il Corriere della Sera, that the problem lies in the fact that what looks like a voluntary agreement should soon turn into a permanent redistribution mechanism requiring more EU countries to do their part and share the burden of the crisis. Giorgio Orlandi for Euronews in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The European Commission is recommending the EU member states extend the authorisation of the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: controversial herbicide glyphosate for another 10 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The proposal is based on an analysis by the European Food Safety Authority, which did not identify critical areas of concern for human or animal health.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Commission says that the recommendation is based on solid scientific information.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: basée sur des informations scientifiques solides.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: En même temps, nous devons bien nous rendre compte du fait que la science ne s'arrête jamais, et donc nous devons continuer à suivre de près toutes les évolutions scientifiques. Nous avons donc essayé de trouver un équilibre entre, d'une part, la masse de données scientifiques qui soutiennent, je pense, la the decision that the Commission has made, on the one hand, with the possibility that new scientific elements may appear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At the same time, the European Commission still says that the use of glyphosate must be accompanied by what it calls risk mitigation measures in the vicinity of sprayed areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Greens and environmental organizations are already declaring their opposition to the announcement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: ANA MARIA, Green Party Member, I think it's a catastrophe. It's completely irresponsible from the commission to go that way with this proposal, an extension of 10 years. I mean, five years ago, we were closed for ban of glyphosate, and that was for very good Five years ago, we were close for ban of glyphosate, and that was for very good reasons, because we don't need glyphosate for productive farming.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We don't need glyphosate to control wheat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In contrary, glyphosate makes at risk or puts at risk really the long-term food security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Glyphosate is an active substance used to control plants. It's the most frequently used herbicide both worldwide and in the E.U., already in use for several decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Member states will now negotiate and vote on the issue, with a decision expected before December 15, when the current E.U. authorization expires.
